intro: Byrsonima pachyphylla f. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered pachyphylla, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in dry or seasonally wet environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
